intro: Allantodia jiulungshanensis, commonly known as the Jiulungshan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with cool, moist climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
